column4: et tìbi reddétur votum in Jerusalíme. ^ A hymn becometh thee
column7: and a vow shall be paid to thee in Jerusalem.

column1: 3 ^ Exáŭdi orațiónem meam~; ad te òmnis carnis vèniet. ^ O hear my prayer~; all flesh shall come to thee.

column2: et impietátibus nostrîs tu propițiáberis. ^ The words of the wicked have prevailed over us
column3: and thou wilt pardon our transgressions.

column1: 5 ^ Beátus qŭem elegìsti et assumpsìsti~; inhabitábit in átriîs tuîs. Replébimur in bonîs domûs tuaĕ~; sanctum est templum tuum
column2: ^ Blessed is he whom thou hast chosen and taken to thee~; he shall dwell in thy courts. We shall be filled with the good things of thy house~; holy is thy temple

column5: et in mari longe. ^ wonderful in justice. Hear us
column8: who art the hope of all the ends of the earth
column9: and in the sea afar off.

column2: accínctus potènția~; ^ Thou who preparest the mountains by thy strength

column3: ^ who troublest the depth of the sea
column4: the noise of its waves. The Gentiles shall be troubled

column1: 9 ^ et timébunt qŭi hábitant tèrminos a sìgnîs tuîs~; èxitûs matutíni et vèspere delectábis. ^ and they that dwell in the uttermost borders shall be afraid at thy signs~; the departures of the morning and of the evening thou shalt delight.
10 ^ Visitavìsti terram et inebriavìsti eam~; multiplicavìsti locupletáre eam. Flumen Dei replétum est aqŭîs~; paravìsti cìbum illórum
column2: qŭóniam ita est praĕparáțio ejus. ^ Thou hast visited the earth and inebriated it~; thou hast many ways enriched it. The river of God is filled with water~; thou hast prepared their food

column1: 11 ^ Rivos ejus inébria~; multìplica genìmina ejus~; in stillicìdiîs ejus laĕtábitur gèrminans. ^ Inebriate the streams thereof~; multiply its fruits~; it shall spring up and rejoice in its showers.

column2: et campi tui replebùntur ubertáte. ^ Thou shalt bless the crown of the year of thy goodness
column3: and thy fields shall be filled with plenty.

column2: et exsultațióne colles accingèntur. ^ The beautiful things of the wilderness shall grow fat
column3: and the hills shall be girded about with joy.
ètenim hìmnum dicent. ^ The rams of the flock are clothed
column4: and the vales shall abound with corn~; they shall shout
column5: yea they shall sing a hymn.
